String.Source: Washing them clean could triple their value.
String.Dest: 把它们洗洗干净就能值三倍的价钱。

String.Source: Indeed. I wash them at the Drunken Huntsmen before I take them to Belethor. I keep them dirty for now to lower their value and dissuade thieves.
String.Dest: 确实如此。在把带去贝莱托尔那儿之前我会先在酩酊猎人把它们清洗一下。现在我先让看起来它们脏兮兮的，这样小偷就会觉得它们不值钱放我一马了。

String.Source: Yes, you got me. It was my plan all along to copy the worst idea ever.
String.Dest: 哦，被你发现了，我的计划就是直接照抄这糟透了的主意。

String.Source: Oh, ha-ha. Laugh it up stranger, but we'll see who's laughing when I'm in the cloud district, dining with the other lords.
String.Dest: Oh, ha-ha. Laugh it up stranger, but we'll see who's laughing when I'm in the cloud district, dining with the other lords.

String.Source: Real estate is not something you can just buy. Someone has to sell.
String.Dest: 地产可不是你说买就能买到的，得有人出售才行。

String.Source: Unfortunately, you're right about that. And you have to be a resident to get a seat at the Jarl's table.
String.Dest: 你很不幸地说中了，只有成为这里的居民，才能领主的桌边享有一席之位。

String.Source: Real estate is not something you can just buy. Someone has to sell.
String.Dest: 地产可不是你说买就能买到的，得有人出售才行。

String.Source: I was hoping to save up for a place like Breezehome, but I don't have the coin just yet.
String.Dest: 我希望能存钱买到一个风宅那样的地方，但我还一枚硬币都没有呢。

String.Source: Real estate is not something you can just buy. Someone has to sell.
String.Dest: 地产可不是你说买就能买到的，得有人出售才行。

String.Source: Then there's the politics. Don't know whose spear you have to polish to get on top of the waiting list, but I imagine it tastes foul going down.
String.Dest: 然后就是政治了。你不知道该去跪舔哪位爷的大屌来使自己在候选名单上高居榜首，但我想吞那玩意一定超级恶心。

String.Source: I have a house in Whiterun. It's quaint.
String.Dest: 我在白漫城有个典雅的房子。

String.Source: What? You? What did you do, save the city? Oh wait, you did, didn't you. I bet the greedy bastards still didn't give you a discount.
String.Dest: 什么？你？你做了什么，救了城市吗？哦，等一下， 你做了，不是么。我打赌那个贪婪的混蛋仍然什么回扣都没给你。

String.Source: Are there any items of no value to anyone?
String.Dest: 难道还有东西是对任何人都无价值的？

String.Source: Burned books. I found that out the hard way when even Belethor refused to buy them. Not even good for kindling, he said.
String.Dest: 烧掉那些书。在即使连贝莱托尔也不想买它们的时候，我发现这不是件容易事儿。那些书都不怎么好烧，他说。

String.Source: Are there any items of no value to anyone?
String.Dest: 难道还有东西是对任何人都无价值的？

String.Source: Now I've got enough worthless books to fill the library in Winterhold, but I'm still holding out hope the market will turn.
String.Dest: 现在我已经有足够的珍贵书籍珍藏在冬堡图书馆, 但我依然希望市场会有所好转。

String.Source: You invested poorly. Ruined books are where the profit is.
String.Dest: 你这投资回报太惨了，所有的利润就是这些残破的书本。.

String.Source: Ah, so you're a junk man as well. I know the value of a ruined book. Especially in the winter, they'll work just as good as firewood.
String.Dest: 啊，原来你也是捡破烂的。我知道这些破败的书籍的价值。尤其是在冬天时，它们跟木柴一样好用。

String.Source: You invested poorly. Ruined books are where the profit is.
String.Dest: 你这投资回报太惨了，所有的利润就是这些残破的书本。.

String.Source: Especially the thick volumes, like "The Wolf Queen," or one of Barenziah's 900 biographies.
String.Dest: Especially the thick volumes, like "The Wolf Queen," or one of Barenziah's 900 biographies.

String.Source: You invested poorly. Ruined books are where the profit is.
String.Dest: 你这投资回报太惨了，所有的利润就是这些残破的书本。.

String.Source: But some of the rarer books I save for more discerning buyers. Even with half the pages ruined, they're still worth something to collectors.
String.Dest: 但一些罕见的书我都留给了更为识货的买家。即使有半本儿书已经毁了，但它们仍有一些收藏的价值。

String.Source: A shrewd business plan. I wish I'd thought of it.
String.Dest: 一个精明的商业计划。我应该想到这一点的。

String.Source: It may be shrewd, but it takes a long time to bear fruit. I have to play the market right, or else the only person I'll make rich is Belethor.
String.Dest: 这或许确实是个精明的计划，不过得花很长时间才能起效。我得把这个市场的运营拉上正轨，否则发财的人就不是我而是贝莱托尔了。

String.Source: Aren't you worried people will just steal your inventory?
String.Dest: 你难道不担心人们会偷你的东西么？

String.Source: Worried? (Laughs) You must be mad if you think someone is going to risk the ire of the guard to steal a bunch of dirty bowls and forks.
String.Dest: 担心吗？(笑声)你一定是疯了才会觉得有人会冒着惹怒守卫的危险去偷一堆脏碗和刀叉。

String.Source: Hello, I'm Eldar, owner of Eldar's Junk Emporium at Whitewatch Tower. See me at my store if you want to leave any junk you find on your travels.
String.Dest: 您好，我是尔达尔, 白望塔的尔达尔废品大卖场的店主. 。如果您想要处理任何在旅行中得到的不需要的东西，请随时光临小店。

String.Source: Welcome to Eldar's Junk Emporium, traveler! I'll take any junk you've found on your travels, for a nominal fee.
String.Dest: 欢迎来到爱尔达垃圾商场！我将带走您在旅行中找到的任何垃圾，并象征性地收取一点费用。

String.Source: Good. I hate that guy.
String.Dest: 好极了，我讨厌那个家伙。

String.Source: Smarmy fetcher has lots of enemies. Says stuff like, "Do you get to the cloud district often? Of course you don't, because you're a filthy beggar."
String.Dest: 虚情假意的访问者总是树敌颇多。比如说“你经常去云霄区吗？哦你当然不常去啦，因为你只是个肮脏的乞丐。”

String.Source: Good. I hate that guy.
String.Dest: 好极了，我讨厌那个家伙。

String.Source: Well, this beggar's going to own all of Dragonsreach by the time he's done.
String.Dest: 当他完成之时就是这个乞丐拥有龙宵宫之时。

String.Source: Impossible. You already own a premium location.
String.Dest: 没门儿！你已经有一个超好的位置了。

String.Source: That's right. Guards stationed day and night, and all the weary adventurers an Elf could ask for.
String.Dest: That's right. Guards stationed day and night, and all the weary adventurers an Elf could ask for.

String.Source: How do you determine what's junk? You must have some value system.
String.Dest: 你怎样决定什么是垃圾？你一定有一些价值观。

String.Source: You're a clever one to see that. As you might expect, I can't put anything too valuable in the chest, or it'd be too difficult to guard.
String.Dest: 你是个聪明人，正如你所想到的，我不能把那些太有价值的东西放在箱子里，否则想防护起来就太过困难了。

String.Source: How do you determine what's junk? You must have some value system.
String.Dest: 你怎样决定什么是垃圾？你一定有一些价值观。

String.Source: Now the guards here will stop the occasional thief so long as I wet their beaks.
String.Dest: 现在只要我请保安长官喝几杯，就能让守卫替我解决掉时不时发生的的盗窃案件。

String.Source: How do you determine what's junk? You must have some value system.
String.Dest: 你怎样决定什么是垃圾？你一定有一些价值观。

String.Source: But if my business attracts hordes of bandits and other unmentionables, then suddenly my coin ain't worth the price of me being here.
String.Dest: 万一强盗或者其他的什么打上了我的生意的主意，那我岂不是突然就变得一无所有了吗?

String.Source: How do you determine what's junk? You must have some value system.
String.Dest: 你怎样决定什么是垃圾？你一定有一些价值观。

String.Source: With the money I've earned, I suppose I could open a separate stall in Whiterun for more valuable goods.
String.Dest: 我用自己挣来的钱，可以在白漫城开另一个摊子卖更好的东西。

String.Source: How do you determine what's junk? You must have some value system.
String.Dest: 你怎样决定什么是垃圾？你一定有一些价值观。

String.Source: But the overhead doesn't justify the profits, especially with the Jarl's taxes and everyone else undercutting my prices.
String.Dest: But the overhead doesn't justify the profits, especially with the Jarl's taxes and everyone else undercutting my prices.

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: That's right, a flat fee of 20 gold for taking your junk off your hands. I also take any items of acceptable value.
String.Dest: 对的, 给你20金币收购你手上的垃圾. 我也会以合理的价格收购任何东西.

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: You can hand any items over to me or leave them in the chest. It's all on the honor system.
String.Dest: 你可以把东西交给我保管或者把它们留在箱子里。这些都是比较体面的做法。

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: So drop what you can, and take what you must. That's our motto at Eldar's Junk Emporium.
String.Dest: 弃你可离，取你所需。在艾尔达跳蚤市场，这就是至理名言。

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: That's right, a flat fee of 20 gold for taking your junk off your hands. I also take any items of acceptable value.
String.Dest: 对的, 给你20金币收购你手上的垃圾. 我也会以合理的价格收购任何东西.

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: You can hand any items over to me or leave them in the chest at Whitewatch Tower. It's all on the honor system.
String.Dest: 你可以把任何东西交给我或者仍在白望塔楼的箱子里。它们都会【记录在荣耀系统】上。

String.Source: Wait, you want me to pay you to take my junk?
String.Dest: 等一下，你是说我出钱请你拿走我的垃圾？

String.Source: So drop what you can, and take what you must. That's our motto at Eldar's Junk Emporium.
String.Dest: 弃你可离，取你所需。在艾尔达跳蚤市场，这就是至理名言。

String.Source: What if I replaced the college books with your burned ones and you sold them?
String.Dest: 如果我用学院的书来换你这些被烧掉的，你会把它们卖掉吗？

String.Source: Not a good idea. The books would be way too valuable, and the evidence would point right to me.
String.Dest: 不是个好主意。那些书实在太贵重，而且所有证据都会直接指向我。

String.Source: Nazeem's already dead.
String.Dest: 纳齐姆已经死了。

String.Source: What? You lie. There's no way anyone would let him off so easy.
String.Dest: 什么？你撒谎。没人能让他那么容易的就离开。

String.Source: (Lie) Nazeem's already dead.
String.Dest: （撒谎）纳奇姆已经死了。

String.Source: Really? Then who was that smarmy Redguard I bumped into in the Market District the other day? His brother?
String.Dest: 真的？是那天在Market District迎面撞上我的红卫人？他的兄弟？

String.Source: So now you hoard other people's junk as well?
String.Dest: 所以你现在也开始处理别人的麻烦了？

String.Source: That's right. I've found people are willing to pay you gold to take their junk off their hands.
String.Dest: 这就是了。我发现人们都愿意给你钱，让你给他们的脏活儿擦屁股。

String.Source: So now you hoard other people's junk as well?
String.Dest: 所以你现在也开始处理别人的麻烦了？

String.Source: Most of whom are adventurers, who come out of a cave with more loot than they can carry, only to find it's still a 3 hour walk to Whiterun.
String.Dest: 大多数是冒险家，从洞里搜刮出的东西多到根本扛不动，却发现自己离雪漫城还有三个小时的脚程。

String.Source: So now you hoard other people's junk as well?
String.Dest: 所以你现在也开始处理别人的麻烦了？

String.Source: I'm in the business of greed and fatigue, traveler. The greed makes 'em pick up the junk, and the fatigue makes 'em drop it.
String.Dest: 我以贪婪和疲惫为生，旅行者。贪婪使他们捡起了垃圾，而疲惫又让他们扔掉了它。

String.Source: So now you hoard other people's junk as well?
String.Dest: 所以你现在也开始处理别人的麻烦了？

String.Source: That's where I come in. I turn their junk around and sell it to Belethor. Divines only know who purchases it from him.
String.Dest: 而我的作用就体现在这一环节。我变废为宝然后将它们卖给贝莱托尔。不过大概只有神才知道他把那些东西卖给谁了。

String.Source: Would there be any? Profits?
String.Dest: 哪里还有吗， 利润?

String.Source: Indeed. I've found people are willing to pay you gold to take their junk off their hands.
String.Dest: Indeed. I've found people are willing to pay you gold to take their junk off their hands.

String.Source: Would there be any? Profits?
String.Dest: 哪里还有吗， 利润?

String.Source: Most of 'em are adventurers, who come out of a cave with more loot than they can carry, only to find it's still a three hour walk back to Whiterun.
String.Dest: 大多从山洞掠回各种超越人体负重极限的战利品的家伙，都是些冒险者。只是他们隔三差五的就得回雪漫城一趟。

String.Source: Would there be any? Profits?
String.Dest: 哪里还有吗， 利润?

String.Source: I'm in the business of greed and fatigue, traveler. The greed makes 'em pick up the junk, and the fatigue makes 'em drop it.
String.Dest: 我做的是贪婪与疲倦的生意，旅行者。是贪婪让人们建起那些垃圾，而疲倦让他们想要丢弃。

String.Source: Would there be any? Profits?
String.Dest: 哪里还有吗， 利润?

String.Source: That's where I come in. I turn their junk around and sell it to Belethor. Divines only know who purchases it from him.
String.Dest: 而我的作用就体现在这一环节。我变废为宝然后将它们卖给贝莱托尔。不过大概只有神才知道他把那些东西卖给谁了。

String.Source: Some people call this junk...
String.Dest: 有的人管这叫垃圾…

String.Source: Indeed. I rushed home and picked up every worthless trinket, every old rag, piece of lint, and loaf of moldy old bread I could find.
String.Dest: 确实。我跑回家拿起我能找到的每一个不值钱的项链，每一块抹布，每一个线头，和每一块发霉的面包。

String.Source: Some people call this junk...
String.Dest: 有的人管这叫垃圾…

String.Source: Now he didn't buy everything of course, but he bought enough to where I didn't have to sell the silverware.
String.Dest: 现在他当然没把所有东西都买下，不过跟他交易换来的钱已经足够让我不至于卖掉银器了。

String.Source: Some people call this junk...
String.Dest: 有的人管这叫垃圾…

String.Source: More importantly, I had stumbled upon an idea.
String.Dest: 更重要的是，我灵光一现想出了一个主意。

String.Source: Some people call this junk...
String.Dest: 有的人管这叫垃圾…

String.Source: If people willing to buy all the crap most of us throw away, then imagine the profits to be had in collecting it.
String.Dest: 如果人们愿意购买被我们中的大多数人扔掉的垃圾，那么可以想象收集那些垃圾所能带来的巨大利润。

String.Source: True, those roads are certainly notorious.
String.Dest: 确实，这些道路的名声的确不怎么样。

String.Source: Travelers from the east, however, face no peril other than the occasional divot in the road, and the stare of Vantus' wife.
String.Dest: 旅行者从东边而来，无论如何，他没有遇到比地面上的草皮，还有跟万图斯的妻子凝视更危险的事了。

String.Source: True, those roads are certainly notorious.
String.Dest: 确实，这些道路的名声的确不怎么样。

String.Source: There are no bandits to alleviate them of their burdens, or any shops to do the same.
String.Dest: 没有谁能让他们的货减轻点儿，不论是商店还是强盗。

String.Source: True, those roads are certainly notorious.
String.Dest: 确实，这些道路的名声的确不怎么样。

String.Source: Their only foe is a shallow incline, but to an over-encumbered soul, it can seem larger than any dragon.
String.Dest: 他们唯一的敌人是一个缓坡，但是对于一个劳累过度的人来说，那比任何一条巨龙都要庞大。

String.Source: True, those roads are certainly notorious.
String.Dest: 确实，这些道路的名声的确不怎么样。

String.Source: Yet it's only when they conquer the hill that they truly accept defeat. For when they reach the apex, they find Dragonsreach tantalizingly close.
String.Dest: 然而当他们占领山顶时才真的意识到自己的失败。在他们冲上山顶后，他们焦躁地发现龙临厅的大门是关上的。

String.Source: True, those roads are certainly notorious.
String.Dest: 确实，这些道路的名声的确不怎么样。

String.Source: The entrance, however, is all the way on the other side.
String.Dest: 无论如何，入口都在路的另一边。

String.Source: Why set up at Whitewatch Tower?
String.Dest: 为什么要建立在白漫哨塔?

String.Source: It's a prime location. To the north is empty tundra and Giant camps, and the guard station is too close to Fort Greymoor for my liking.
String.Dest: 这是很重要的地点。往北是空旷的苔原和巨人营地，警卫站对我来说距离灰色荒原堡垒太近了。

String.Source: Why set up at Whitewatch Tower?
String.Dest: 为什么要建立在白漫哨塔?

String.Source: To the west, you have Riverwood, where most travelers have already unloaded their wares at Lucan's shop.
String.Dest: 向西走，你就会到河木镇,那里大多数的旅行者都在Lucan的商店里出售他们的商品。

String.Source: Why set up at Whitewatch Tower?
String.Dest: 为什么要建立在白漫哨塔?

String.Source: The mountains loom over the south, peaks which no mortal dare climb, and to the southeast lay the Valtheim Towers, which bandits often occupy.
String.Dest: 山脉赫然耸立在南部，其间的山脉无人胆敢攀爬。东南之处坐落着沃尔瑟姆塔楼，那里一直以来都被强盗牢牢占据着。

String.Source: It's mad enough to work, but stupid enough to fail.
String.Dest: 干这活儿是太疯狂，可没干成是太愚蠢。

String.Source: That is music to my ears, sera, for a truly great idea is often mistaken for madness.
String.Dest: That is music to my ears, sera, for a truly great idea is often mistaken for madness.

String.Source: It's mad enough to work, but stupid enough to fail.
String.Dest: 干这活儿是太疯狂，可没干成是太愚蠢。

String.Source: Such ideas are separated from us like the farms surrounding the city. The great thinkers are mocked for trying to see them through walls of stone.
String.Dest: 这想法从我们这里分离出去如农场围绕着城市一般。 伟大的思考者们试着看着它们穿越石墙。

String.Source: It's mad enough to work, but stupid enough to fail.
String.Dest: 干这活儿是太疯狂，可没干成是太愚蠢。

String.Source: When an idea is a success, everyone assumes he actually did it. See through walls of stone. When all he really did was stand on his toes.
String.Dest: 当一个主意获得成功时，每个人都认为事情是他亲自做的。而他需要的只是敏锐的洞察力。他事实上连指头都不用动一下。

String.Source: I'm an adventurer, not some lowly shopkeep.
String.Dest: 我仍然是个冒险家，不是什么狗屁的杂货店主。

String.Source: Is that what you call yourselves? I like to call you my pack mules. Now do you have any questions, or are we done here?
String.Dest: 你们是那么称呼自己的？我喜欢把你们叫做屌丝帮。现在你还有任何问题吗？还是说我们可以结束了？

String.Source: I've met broomsticks with more business sense.
String.Dest: 我已发现扫帚的商业意义了。

String.Source: Ha! Brooms happen to be some of my most popular pieces. Lots of death means lots of empty rooms and piles of dust.
String.Dest: 哈！扫帚碰巧是我最受欢迎的作品。大量的死亡意味着一堆的空屋子和满屋子灰。

String.Source: I've met broomsticks with more business sense.
String.Dest: 我已发现扫帚的商业意义了。

String.Source: While you're slaving in some mine trying to pluck a flawless diamond, I'll have traded my brooms for seven.
String.Dest: 当你在不知道哪些矿洞里苦苦需找一个完美无瑕的钻石的时候，我已经卖出去七把扫帚了。

String.Source: I was, but I changed my mind now that you're on to me.
String.Dest: 是的，但我现在不觉得你看穿我了。

String.Source: Good, you saved yourself a lot of heartache. I've surveyed the land around here, and this is the best location for a business of this type.
String.Dest: 好极了，你去除了你的心病。我已经调查过这周围了，这是做这类生意的最佳地段。

String.Source: Why Nazeem?
String.Dest: 为什么是纳奇姆?

String.Source: When he fired me, I thought of ways to get back at him. Poison his food, bed his wife, burn his crops. In the end though, it wasn't worth it.
String.Dest: 当他向我发动攻击时，我就想了各种办法报复他。给他的食物投毒，睡他老婆，烧他庄稼。最后我想想，我觉得不值得。

String.Source: Why Nazeem?
String.Dest: 为什么是纳奇姆?

String.Source: None of those things mattered to him, and when all accounts were settled he'd still be rich and I'd still be poor.
String.Dest: 这些事他一个都不在乎，当所有的账目都稳当了，他富得流油，而我仍一贫如洗。

String.Source: Why Nazeem?
String.Dest: 为什么是纳奇姆?

String.Source: But if a poor farmer somehow managed to worm his way to the Cloud District...
String.Dest: 但如果一个卑贱的农民不知怎的的混进了云霄区 ...

String.Source: Why Nazeem?
String.Dest: 为什么是纳奇姆?

String.Source: Well, people would think he was the Skyforge the way the steam would come out of his ears.
String.Dest: 嗯，人们可能会认为他就是天空熔炉，然后蒸汽从他耳朵冒出来。

String.Source: Is this your long term business plan?
String.Dest: 这就是你这生意的远景规划？

String.Source: Depends on what you mean. But no, I don't plan on being here forever.
String.Dest: 看你的意思了。但是我可不打算永远待在这里噢。

String.Source: Is this your long term business plan?
String.Dest: 这就是你这生意的远景规划？

String.Source: My goal is to buy a house in Whiterun, and run my own business in the Market District.
String.Dest: 我的目标是在白漫城买一栋房子，然后在云霄区开一家属于我自己的商店。

String.Source: Is this your long term business plan?
String.Dest: 这就是你这生意的远景规划？

String.Source: But my motivation is to get a seat at the Jarl's table, right across from Nazeem.
String.Dest: 但我只是想在领主的议事桌上得到一个位置而已，一个刚好面对纳奇姆的位置。

String.Source: What sort of junk do you collect?
String.Dest: 你在收集什么破烂？

String.Source: Why? Are you trying to muscle in on my business?
String.Dest: 为什么？你想插手我的生意吗？

String.Source: Not by themselves, but a thousand forks and knives would be valuable.
String.Dest: 它们本身并不起眼，不过数量大了可就值钱了。

String.Source: But only if you had the patience to move them. Even Belethor wouldn't buy all the junk in my inventory. I have to wait until his stock runs low.
String.Dest: 除非你有耐心去搬它们。连贝莱托尔都不会把我货物清单上的什物全买下来。得等到他存货用得差不多的时候。

String.Source: Not by themselves, but a thousand forks and knives would be valuable.
String.Dest: 它们本身并不起眼，不过数量大了可就值钱了。

String.Source: Once market demand is high and supply is low, then I make my move. That's the only way this junk has any value. This can take months, even years.
String.Dest: 一旦市场上供不应求，就该我出行动了。这是唯一让这堆破烂儿能产生什么价值的方法。而这会耗时数月，甚至数年的时间。

String.Source: Not by themselves, but a thousand forks and knives would be valuable.
String.Dest: 它们本身并不起眼，不过数量大了可就值钱了。

String.Source: No thief has the patience to wait this long, not when there are plenty of other things he can steal, and not when his stomach growls for food.
String.Dest: 没有哪个盗贼会有如此耐心等待这么久的，除非有大量的东西可以偷到，或者他们实在是饥肠辘辘了。

String.Source: Some polish spears. Others slay dragons.
String.Dest: 有的人负责擦亮长矛，有的人负责杀死巨龙。

String.Source: Do I look like a dragon slayer? Wait, that came out wrong. Makes it sound like I look like a spear polisher.
String.Dest: 我看起来像个屠龙者吗？等等，那明显是错的。原因可能是我看起来像个打磨长矛的人吧。

String.Source: So what did you do?
String.Dest: 那么你做了什么？

String.Source: I rolled them up in an old cloth, and went to Belethor to get it appraised.
String.Dest: 我拿了件旧衣服把它们包起来，冲去 Belethor 杂货店估了个价。

String.Source: So what did you do?
String.Dest: 那么你做了什么？

String.Source: Only when I placed the set on the counter, I noticed there was an old wooden spoon lumped in with the silverware.
String.Dest: 当我把这套东西放在台面上时，我发现银器里熔进了一根老旧木勺。

String.Source: So what did you do?
String.Dest: 那么你做了什么？

String.Source: I chuckled, of course, and was about to slide the spoon into my tunic when Belethor asked me, "How much?" I asked him, "For the silverware?"
String.Dest: 我呵呵一笑，当然，汤勺滑进我的外套的同时，贝莱托尔问我：“多少钱？”我则问他：“是银的吗？”

String.Source: So what did you do?
String.Dest: 那么你做了什么？

String.Source: And the fool said, "No! No, the spoon!"
String.Dest: 然后一个蠢货说：“不！别用勺子！”

String.Source: What do you plan to do with all that junk?
String.Dest: 你打算用那些垃圾做些什么？

String.Source: Why, sell it of course. The idea came to me when I was shopping at Belethor's General Goods Store.
String.Dest: 为什么，当然是卖掉它了。我在贝莱托尔日用品店购物的时候就想这么干了。

String.Source: What do you plan to do with all that junk?
String.Dest: 你打算用那些垃圾做些什么？

String.Source: It was about a year ago, after Nazeem had fired me from Chillfurrow Farm for sleeping on the job.
String.Dest: 大概是一年以前的事情了，在我因为工作时睡觉而被纳奇姆从寒犁农场炒鱿鱼以后。

String.Source: What do you plan to do with all that junk?
String.Dest: 你打算用那些垃圾做些什么？

String.Source: Anyway, I was desperate for coin, and I decided to sell a set of antique silverware that I had kept packed away in an old sack.
String.Dest: 无论如何，我现在缺钱，我决定卖掉一套我已经在袋子里整理好的银质古董。

String.Source: What do you plan to do with all that junk?
String.Dest: 你打算用那些垃圾做些什么？

String.Source: It was a family heirloom, and I was loathe to part with it, but it was the only thing in my possession worth a bloody septim.
String.Dest: 这是我家里的传家宝，我真的不想割舍它。 但这是我唯一能换点不幸的钱的财产了。

String.Source: The last one who called me mad, I sewed his mouth shut. Now he calls me "mmm."
String.Dest: 上一位管我叫疯子的，我把他的嘴缝上了。现在他管我叫"唔唔唔…"

String.Source: Oh, I meant no offense, traveler. But if you'd like to leave your needle and thread in the box, I'd be willing to waive the fee.
String.Dest: 哦，没有冒犯之意，旅行者。但如果你想把自己的针线留在这个盒子里，我就不收钱了。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Take a look.
String.Dest: 随意看看。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Some people call this junk, but not Belethor.
String.Dest: 有些人把这叫做垃圾，贝莱托尔可不会。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Forks, brooms, pretty much everything you don't need.
String.Dest: 叉子，扫帚，都是些你完全不需要的东西。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Ah, nothing like a batch of fresh junk to brighten my day.
String.Dest: 啊，没什么东西能像一堆新鲜的垃圾一样让我眼前一亮了。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Over-encumbered traveler? I can help you with that.
String.Dest: 你身上带的东西超重了吗？我能帮你分担一点儿。

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: The finest brooms in Tamriel.
String.Dest: 泰姆瑞尔最好的扫帚

String.Source: What do you have for sale?
String.Dest: 你有卖什么？

String.Source: Glass jars? Of course! They come in broken, and busted.
String.Dest: 玻璃瓶？当然！它们在被发现的时候就已经破损毁坏了。

String.Source: You forgot basic knives and forks. Worthless.
String.Dest: 你这个渣滓连刀叉都不会用了。

String.Source: Maybe now, but unlike burned books, they still have utility.
String.Dest: Maybe now, but unlike burned books, they still have utility.

String.Source: You forgot basic knives and forks. Worthless.
String.Dest: 你这个渣滓连刀叉都不会用了。

String.Source: In fact, the market may change soon, with blacksmiths too busy forging swords to bother with common dinnerware.
String.Dest: In fact, the market may change soon, with blacksmiths too busy forging swords to bother with common dinnerware.

String.Source: I don't know if revenge is worth living in a troll den like Whiterun.
String.Dest: 我不知道为了复仇住在像雪漫那样的巨魔巢穴里是不是值得的。

String.Source: Oh, and where would you rather live? Solitude? An entire city full of people like Nazeem. Riften? You'll lose your home before you get the door open.
String.Dest: 噢，那你更喜欢在哪里生活呢？独孤城？满大街都是纳兹姆之流的装13犯。裂谷城？在你把门打开之前家里的东西就能丢光了啊。

String.Source: I don't know if revenge is worth living in a troll den like Whiterun.
String.Dest: 我不知道为了复仇住在像雪漫那样的巨魔巢穴里是不是值得的。

String.Source: Markarth? Who wants to live near a prison. And there's no way a Dark Elf like me is moving to Windhelm.
String.Dest: 马卡斯城？谁会愿意住在一座监狱旁边。而且像我这样的黑精灵也没办法搬到风盔城。

String.Source: I'm telling Nazeem right now of your plans. You're ruined.
String.Dest: 我正把你的计划告诉纳齐姆，你完蛋了。

String.Source: Go ahead. That high-minded fool will laugh in your face, right before he spits in it.
String.Dest: 去吧。那个自大的白痴肯定会先对着你得意地笑，然后笑不出来，恼羞成怒的。

String.Source: I'm telling Nazeem right now of your plans. You're ruined.
String.Dest: 我正把你的计划告诉纳齐姆，你完蛋了。

String.Source: There's no one in all of Tamriel who has a lower opinion of what I collect, and the man who collects them.
String.Dest: 整个塔玛瑞尔大陆无人对我的收藏物，及收藏者我有所异议。

String.Source: Until next time.
String.Dest: 下回见。

String.Source: All right, then.
String.Dest: 那就这样吧。

String.Source: Be seeing you.
String.Dest: 再见。

String.Source: Please, do come back. (Laughs) Sorry, I couldn't help myself.
String.Dest: 求你了，回来吧。（笑声）对不起，我帮不了我自己。

String.Source: Remember traveler, pick up everything that isn't nailed to the floor. And maybe those things too if you can manage.
String.Dest: 旅行者，记住了啊。地上所有能采的都给它采走。或许会有用呢。

String.Source: Satchel feeling a bit heavy? Come see me at my store at Whitewatch Tower.
String.Dest: 感觉背包有点重吗？来皖城哨塔的商店见我吧。

String.Source: One day I'll take my place at the Jarl's table. And when I do, the look on Nazeem's face will have made all the struggle worth it.
String.Dest: 会有那么一天，领主的桌子会出现我属于的位置。而当我做到了的时候，纳奇姆脸上精彩的表情将证明我的一切努力都没白费。。

String.Source: Too much junk weighing you down? For twenty gold I can take it off your hands for you.
String.Dest: 包里垃圾太多拿不动了？给我20块就帮你处理掉。

String.Source: You don't happen to have any spare brooms, do you?
String.Dest: 你该不会正好有备用的扫帚吧？

String.Source: Greetings.
String.Dest: 你好。

String.Source: Need something?
String.Dest: 有事吗？

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: Not many people can find the place, to be honest, since it's not on any map.
String.Dest: 说实话，没多少人能找到这个地方。因为那里在任何一份地图上都没有标示。

String.Source: How do you know the scene hasn't been tampered with?
String.Dest: 你们怎么能确保现在看到的这些没有被篡改过。

String.Source: The only reason the guard were able to arrest my father is because he was forced to spend the night in Solitude.
String.Dest: 守卫逮捕我父亲唯一可行的理由就是他非自愿而不得不在独孤城过了一夜。

String.Source: Well, then let their families know. Someone has to inherit all their junk.
String.Dest: 哎，那就去告诉他们全家吧。总要有人继承他们全部的垃圾。

String.Source: Iria, if you tend to any over-encumbered soldiers, let them know about my store.
String.Dest: Iria, if you tend to any over-encumbered soldiers, let them know about my store.
